sense.name: the act or process of branching, forking
sense.examples: The Japanese gardner did some beautiful ramification of John's bonsai trees. Nerve growth factor (NGF) enhanced the ramification process.

sense.name: a structure that is subdivided via branches
sense.commentary: RAMIFICATION[+form][+structure][+subordinate][+branched] Note: includes physical and abstract/social structures
sense.examples: His is an extended family with its ramifications of in-laws and third cousins. This diagram shows the ramification of the superficial branch of the radial nervus.

sense.name: a complicating consequence of a prior event or state
sense.examples: Any change is bound to have legal ramifications. What would be the ramifications of the Canadians establishing a deep water military port there?
